abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Multi-sector
            Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project for Guinea-Bissau  is
            to improve the institutional and management capacity and
            governance in the power, water and roads sectors. The
            changes will: (i) reallocate resources from the initially
            planned roads rehabilitation works and water storage
            construction towards: (a) increasing energy supply to the
            city of Bissau by financing 5.5 MW of thermal generation
            capacity (3MW bought and 2.5MW leased) and the acquisition
            of power distribution equipment for Electricidade e Aguas da
            Guink-Bissau (EAGB), the national electricity and water
            utility. (Political instability and sector mismanagement
            contributed to the difficulty of attracting private
            participation in the power sector. This private
            participation, which did not materialize, was initially
            foreseen to add 15 MW of leased generating capacity.); and
            (b) providing technical support for the preparation of
            EAGB's restructuring under a Private Public Partnership
            (PPP) arrangement, complementary to funds made available
            under the proposed Emergency Electricity and Water
            Rehabilitation Project (EEWRP); (ii) allow for additional
            time to complete project activities for which some delays
            have been experienced; and (iii) revise the results
            framework to reflect the corresponding changes in the
            project's expected results.
